sentences:
Angélique Paulet ( 1592 – 1651 ) was a French précieuse , singer and lute - playing musician , one of the habitués of the famous literary salon of Catherine de Vivonne , marquise de Rambouillet , where she was called La Lionne rousse and La belle Lionne because of her red hair and proud poise .
She often performed at the assemblies of the Chambre bleue by singing and playing the lute .
She was the daughter of the financier , one of king Henry IV of France 's secretaries .
According to Gédéon Tallemant des Réaux , Henry IV was assassinated while on his way to visit her .
The musical instrument angélique , which first appeared in Paris in the 17th century , may have been named after her .
